2048 2048 application/vnd.ogc.wms_xml text/xml image/bmp image/jpeg image/tiff image/png image/png8 image/png24 image/png32 image/gif image/svg+xml application/vnd.esri.wms_raw_xml application/vnd.esri.wms_featureinfo_xml application/vnd.ogc.wms_xml application/geojson text/xml text/html text/plain application/vnd.ogc.sld+xml application/vnd.ogc.se_xml application/vnd.ogc.se_inimage application/vnd.ogc.se_blank text/xml XML <![CDATA[AIR]]> CRS:84 EPSG:4326 EPSG:4269 -179.231086179.859681-14.60181371.441059 <![CDATA[Ozone]]> Full Metadata This map service group layer displays Ozone data from separate sources. The first source is the USEPA's NonAttainment areas using the 1997 8-hour Standard of 0.08 ppm. The data for these polygon areas are described in the USEPA's Green Book (http://www.epa.gov/airquality/greenbook/o8index.html). The second source is a combined effort between the USEPA and the Center for Disease Control. The Center of Disease Control's (CDC) Environmental Public Health Tracking (EPHT) data was averaged over three years ( 2004 - 2006). The USEPA's ORD calculated a three year average (2004 - 2006) using the values for Ozone (number of days with the maximum 8-hour average above the National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS)). These data were extracted by the CDC from the USEPA's ambient air monitors and are displayed at the county level. USEPA received the Monitor and Modeled data from the CDC and calculated the three year average displayed in the web service. For more details about the CDC EPHT data, please refer to the CDC EPHT web page (http://ephtracking.cdc.gov/showHome.action).]]> CRS:84 EPSG:4326 EPSG:4269 -179.231086179.859681-14.60181371.441059 1 <![CDATA[3-year Average (2004 - 2006) Number Of Ozone Days With Maximum 8-hr Average Above NAAQS]]> Full Metadata This map service layer displays Ozone data from a combined effort between the USEPA and the Center for Disease Control. The Center of Disease Control's (CDC) Environmental Public Health Tracking (EPHT) data was averaged over three years ( 2004 - 2006). The USEPA's ORD calculated a three year average (2004 - 2006) using the values for Ozone (number of days with the maximum 8-hour average above the National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS)) and PM 2.5 (annual ambient concentration). These data were extracted by the CDC from the USEPA's ambient air monitors and are displayed at the county level. USEPA received the Monitor and Modeled data from the CDC and calculated the three year average displayed in the web service. For more details about the CDC EPHT data, please refer to the CDC EPHT web page (http://ephtracking.cdc.gov/showHome.action).]]> CRS:84 EPSG:4326 EPSG:4269 -179.231086179.859681-14.60181371.441059 2 <![CDATA[NonAttainment Areas For Ozone 1997 8-hr Standard Of 0.08 ppm]]> Full Metadata This map service layer displays Ozone data from the USEPA's NonAttainment areas using the 1997 8-hr Standard of 0.08 ppm. The data for these polygon areas are described in the USEPA's Green Book (http://www.epa.gov/airquality/greenbook/rindex.html). ]]> CRS:84 EPSG:4326 EPSG:4269 -123.106914-67.94330028.82422345.428554 <![CDATA[PM 2.5]]> Full Metadata This map service group layer displays Particulate Matter (PM2.5) data from separate sources. The first source is the USEPA's NonAttainment areas using the 2006 24-hour Standard of 35 ug/m3. The data for these polygon areas are described in the USEPA's Green Book (http://www.epa.gov/airquality/greenbook/rindex.html). The second source is a combined effort between the USEPA and the Center for Disease Control. The Center of Disease Control's (CDC) Environmental Public Health Tracking (EPHT) datawas averaged over three years ( 2004 - 2006). The USEPA's ORD calculated a three year average (2004 - 2006) using the values for PM2.5 (annual ambient concentration). These data were extracted by the CDC from the USEPA's ambient air monitors and are displayed at the county level. USEPA received the Monitor and Modeled data from the CDC and calculated the three year average displayed in the web service. For more details about the CDC EPHT data, please refer to the CDC EPHT web page (http://ephtracking.cdc.gov/showHome.action).]]> CRS:84 EPSG:4326 EPSG:4269 -179.231086179.859681-14.60181371.441059 4 <![CDATA[3-year Average (2004 - 2006) Annual Ambient Concentrations Of PM 2.5 (ug/m3)]]> Full Metadata This map service layer displays Particulate Matter (PM2.5) data. The data are a combined effort between the USEPA and the Center for Disease Control. The Center of Disease Control's (CDC) Environmental Public Health Tracking (EPHT) datawas averaged over three years ( 2004 - 2006). The USEPA's ORD calculated a three year average (2004 - 2006) using the values for PM2.5 (annual ambient concentration). These data were extracted by the CDC from the USEPA's ambient air monitors and are displayed at the county level. USEPA received the Monitor and Modeled data from the CDC and calculated the three year average displayed in the web service. For more details about the CDC EPHT data, please refer to the CDC EPHT web page (http://ephtracking.cdc.gov/showHome.action).]]> CRS:84 EPSG:4326 EPSG:4269 -179.231086179.859681-14.60181371.441059 5 <![CDATA[NonAttainment Areas For PM 2.5 2006 24-hr Standard Of 35 ug/m3]]> Full Metadata This map service layer displays Particulate Matter (PM2.5) data from the USEPA's NonAttainment areas using the 2006 24-hour Standard of 35 ug/m3. The data for these polygon areas are described in the USEPA's Green Book (http://www.epa.gov/airquality/greenbook/rindex.html). ]]> CRS:84 EPSG:4326 EPSG:4269 -148.016946-71.85664031.33271964.978943 <![CDATA[PAH]]> Full Metadata This map service group layer displays Estimated Cancer Respiratory Risk, Estimated Ambient Concentration, and Estimated Exposure Concentration for PAH at the census tract level from USEPA's 2005 National-Scale Air Toxics Assessment (NATA).
